intro: Mischogyne elliotiana var. sericea, commonly known as the silver-haired arrowroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and striking, spadix-like inflorescence. The plant produces a starchy rhizome that is used as a food source in some local communities. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in swampy or wetland areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and culinary purposes.
